Here are five spots that are worth checking out, whether it's for a real breakfast in the morning or that jolt of caffeine you need in the afternoon. Boot CaféSet in an old shoe-repair shop in the Marais, this spot is all about outdoor seating and espresso.Instagram contentThis content can also be viewed on the site it originates from. CaouaThis “coffee stop” alongside Canal Saint- Martin goes full-bore on le brunch (avocado toast, six-minute eggs). Great coffee too!Instagram contentThis content can also be viewed on the site it originates from. CravanWith a picturesque breakfast and correct coffee drinks, this gorgeous café is our antidote to too much cool.Instagram contentThis content can also be viewed on the site it originates from. TélescopeParis’ OG third-wave coffee bar in the 1st is still going strong, with pour- overs made with rare Scandinavian beans.Instagram contentThis content can also be viewed on the site it originates from. Ten BellesThis minuscule café in the 10th is as serious about coffee as it is about food and—amen—bread.Instagram contentThis content can also be viewed on the site it originates from.For even more, check out our full Paris City Guide here.Explore Bon AppétitParisTravelCoffeeRead MoreWhere to eatHow to Eat Healthyish in ParisGallery13 SlidesBy Belle CushingWhere to eat8 Restaurants That Prove Paris Is Anything But Old-SchoolBy Christine MuhlkeRecipes you want to make.
